intro: Phyllanthus chimantae, commonly known as the Chimantá phyllanthus, is a shrub native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It is often found in cloud forests and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
